definition: to lift/to raise/(of two or more persons) to carry

sentences.english: Position child with head of bed slightly elevated to decrease cerebral edema; monitor administration of fluids.
sentences.chinese: 卧床时，床头略微抬高，减少脑水肿，监视补液情况。

sentences.english: Every drop of water that melts from the ice flows into the ocean, raising sea levels.
sentences.chinese: 冰层融化成的每一滴水汇入海洋后，抬高了海平面。

sentences.english: The neck should be raised and gracefully arched, with the poll as the highest point.
sentences.chinese: 马的颈部应当优雅的弓弯抬高，项部位于最高点。

sentences.english: Keep the patient horizontal with the feet slightly raised.
sentences.chinese: 让病人保持平卧，双脚略微抬高。

sentences.english: Lift one edge of each skid strip with a putty knife and peel it from roof panel .
sentences.chinese: 用油灰刀抬高防滑带的一边并且从车顶饰板上剥落它。

sentences.english: I do not want to raise any place in their own worth, and do not highlight.
sentences.chinese: 我不愿在任何地方抬高自己的身价，也不要突出。

sentences.english: Damage to the trochlea could occur, as the periosteum is elevated from bone or during healing.
sentences.chinese: 当骨膜抬高或愈合过程中，滑车可能受到损伤。

sentences.english: However, the global grain price not only depends on the natural reasons but also man-induced factors.
sentences.chinese: 但除了自然原因外，人为因素也抬高了全球粮食价格。

sentences.english: They raise the monitor slightly byelevatingthe back edge of the computer.
sentences.chinese: 它们抬高了电脑的后缘，进而略微升高了显示器。

sentences.english: A few bidders inflated the prices on purpose.
sentences.chinese: 几个投标人故意抬高价钱。

sentences.english: Several companies gang up to raise prices.
sentences.chinese: 几家公司串通一气抬高物价。

sentences.english: I'm not going to dignify his comments by reacting to them.
sentences.chinese: 我才不会理睬他的评论以抬高他的身价。
Towser抬高了声音，充满了愤怒。

sentences.english: The straight-leg testing can guard against and treatconglutination of nerve root after the operation.
sentences.chinese: 直腿抬高运动锻炼可以防治术后神经根粘连。

sentences.english: They raise the monitor slightly by elevating the back edge of the computer.
sentences.chinese: 它们抬高了电脑的后缘，进而略微升高了显示器。

sentences.english: It's even reported that speculators are hoarding a large number of properties to fuel price rises.
sentences.chinese: 甚至有报道说炒房者囤积大量房源以抬高价格。

definition: to raise (one's voice)/to overrate/to build up/to stand out/outstanding
to rise (i.e. number increases)/a price rise/to raise
to lengthen/to pull sth out longer
upward/up/to advance/to try to improve oneself/to make progress
low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline
to bring to the same level/to even up/to flare out/to flatten out
to pull back/to shrink/to contract/(physiology) systole
